availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Simon E. Higgins (Crab Orchard, Kentucky, postmaster, merchant and justice of the peace)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, postmaster, merchant, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Jane C. Higgins. Father of John S. Higgins, Catherine E. Higgins, Mary Susan Higgins, Jeremiah F. Higgins, Margaret Higgins, Calista Higgins, Jane Higgins, S. E. Higgins, and Ephraim P. Higgins. Postmaster in Crab Orchard, Kentucky, from May 6, 1853, to December 12, 1855. Merchant in Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1860. Justice of the peace in Lincoln County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Crab Orchard, p. 54.
"Simon E. Higgins (1818-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial #66965643, accessed July 30, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66965643/simon-e.-higgins.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Lincoln County, Kentucky, vol. 14.
